intro: Phymatopteris wuliangshanensis, commonly known as the Wuliangshan maidenhair fern, is a species of fern native to China. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds. The plant typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its spores are produced on the underside of the fronds, and it reproduces through sexual reproduction. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
